Description: Fragment of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery eye-cup; above foot join, alternating black and void rays; above, six thin bands preserved; interior black with reserved bands decorated with sets of lines (probably tondo border).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the shape see Boardman's review of Venit.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 85 no. 286 pl. 64)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2117)
